title: Mobile-friendly colorful onboarding flow for Customer/Vendor with vendor list and simple vendor dashboard

requirements.text: Replace the current Home page content with a mobile-first landing screen that shows two large primary actions: "Customer Login" and "Vendor Login" as big rounded cards/buttons optimized for touch (large tap targets, clear spacing).

quotes:
Home screen should show two big buttons:
Customer Login
Vendor Login

acceptanceCriteria: On mobile widths, the two actions are prominently visible without relying on the existing marketplace sections
Both actions navigate to their respective flows (Customer Login and Vendor Login) using the app router

requirements.text: Implement the Customer Login Form screen with the following fields and validation: Name (required), Mobile number (required), City dropdown (required; options: Kanpur, Unnao), Area (required), Pin code (required). On submit, navigate to the Vendor List page and carry the selected city forward.

quotes:
Customer Login Form:
- Name
- Mobile
- City dropdown (Kanpur, Unnao)
- Area
- Pin code

After submit show a vendor list page

acceptanceCriteria: The City field is a dropdown limited to exactly: Kanpur, Unnao
Submitting the form without required fields shows clear English validation feedback
Successful submit navigates to the Vendor List page and preserves the selected city for filtering

requirements.text: Implement the Vendor List page that renders vendor cards filtered by the city selected in the Customer Login Form. Each vendor card must show: Shop name, Area, Mobile number, and a "View Shop" button.

quotes:
After submit show a vendor list page with vendor cards:
- Shop name
- Area
- Mobile number
- View Shop button

acceptanceCriteria: The page displays only vendors matching the selected city
Each vendor is rendered as a rounded card with the required fields and a visible "View Shop" button
If no city is present (e.g., direct navigation), the page shows an English prompt to select a city and a way to navigate back to the Customer Login Form

requirements.text: Define the "View Shop" button behavior for the Vendor List page: when pressed, navigate to a vendor shop route/screen (even if minimal for now) that clearly identifies which shop was selected (at minimum show the selected Shop name and city/area).
acceptanceCriteria: Tapping "View Shop" navigates to a dedicated screen/route and does not do nothing
The destination screen shows the selected shop identity in English (at minimum the shop name)

requirements.text: Implement the Vendor Login Form screen with the following fields and validation: Name (required), Mobile (required), City dropdown (required; options: Kanpur, Unnao), Area (required), Pin code (required). On submit, navigate to the Outlet Details form page and carry the entered vendor login info forward.

quotes:
Vendor Login Form:
- Name
- Mobile
- City dropdown (Kanpur, Unnao)
- Area
- Pin code

After submit open outlet details form

acceptanceCriteria: The City field is a dropdown limited to exactly: Kanpur, Unnao
Submitting the form without required fields shows clear English validation feedback
Successful submit navigates to the Outlet Details form page and preserves prior inputs for the flow

requirements.text: Implement the Outlet Details form page with the following fields and validation: Outlet name (required), Outlet photo upload (required UI control; accept images), Outlet mobile (required), Aadhar number (required), GST (optional). On submit, navigate to a simple Vendor Dashboard page and show submitted outlet details there (at minimum: Outlet name).

quotes:
After submit open outlet details form:
- Outlet name
- Outlet photo upload
- Outlet mobile
- Aadhar number
- GST optional

After submit open a simple vendor dashboard page.

acceptanceCriteria: The form includes an image file input for Outlet photo upload and shows a preview or filename after selection
GST is optional and does not block submission when empty
On successful submit, the app navigates to the Vendor Dashboard page and displays the outlet name in English

requirements.text: Create a simple Vendor Dashboard page (not the existing vendor portal dashboard) that is reachable after the Outlet Details submit and presents a clean mobile-first summary card layout (at minimum showing Outlet name; optionally show other submitted fields).

quotes: After submit open a simple vendor dashboard page.

acceptanceCriteria: The dashboard is a distinct screen/route reachable via the Vendor onboarding flow
The dashboard renders correctly on mobile with large readable typography and rounded cards

requirements.text: Apply a consistent modern colorful visual theme across the new Home/Login/List/Outlet/Dashboard screens using rounded cards, large buttons, and soft shadows. Use a coherent non-blue/non-purple palette (e.g., coral/teal/lime or similar) and ensure all user-facing text is in English.

quotes: Create a mobile friendly colorful app.
Use modern colorful UI with rounded cards and large buttons.

acceptanceCriteria: All new screens share the same design language (spacing, radii, shadows, button styles)
Buttons meet mobile touch target expectations (visibly large and easy to tap)
All labels, placeholders, helper text, and messages on the new flow screens are in English

constraints: Do not edit files in frontend.immutablePaths (must compose existing UI components rather than modifying read-only sources).
Keep the backend architecture as a single Motoko actor (no additional backend canisters/services).
Use English for all user-facing text added or modified by this build request.
nonGoals: Do not implement wallet/commission rules, vendor outlet enable/disable logic, or admin oversight features in this build request.
Do not require Internet Identity authentication for the new Customer/Vendor onboarding flow unless explicitly necessary for navigation; keep this flow form-based as requested.
Do not redesign or remove existing storefront/cart/checkout functionality beyond replacing the Home page content as requested.
